label: Dardanelles Strait (Turkey)
description: strait in northwestern Turkey

label: Olympus, Mount (Greece)
description: mountain of Greece

label: Ethiopia
description: country in East Africa

label: Hellas
description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 102 D4 no. 10 (Hellas)

label: Aethiopia
description: Aethiopia is a term used in the Classical sources to refer both to Upper Egypt and the regions south of the Sahara desert. It is employed as early as the time of Homer.

label: Temesa/Tempsa
description: An ancient city located on the west coast of Bruttium, just north of the Gulf of Hipponium.

label: Aeoliae (islands)
description: A volcanic archipelago in the Tyrrhenian Sea composed of eight islands.

label: Arethusae Fons
description: Arethusae Fons is a spring in Ortygia, Sicily, traditionally connected with the nymph Arethusa.

label: Ortygia (island)
description: A coastal island of Sicily that became the center of ancient Syracuse.

label: Sicilia (island)
description: Sicily is the largest island in the Mediterranean Sea and has been the site of human habitation since ca. 8,000 BC. In historical terms Sicily has seen important settlement activity connected to numerous culture groups - Punic, Carthaginian, Greek, Roman, Vandalic, Ostrogothic, Byzantine, Arabic, and Norman.

label: Doliche
description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 50 B4 Doliche

label: Olympos (mountain in Greece)
description: Olympus is the highest mountain in Greece, located in the Olympus Range. In Greek mythology, it is the home of the Olympian gods.

label: Pieria
description: Originally the territory of the Pieres, later incoporated into Macedonia

label: Sintia
description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 50 D2 Sintia

label: Acheron (river)
description: A river of Epirus.

label: Asteria (island)
description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 54 C5 Asteria Ins.

label: Cephallania (island)
description: The largest of the Ionian islands.

label: Dodona
description: An ancient site of northwestern Epirus, Dodona was home to one of the most ancient oracular traditions of the Hellenic world.

label: Dolicha? Ins.
description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 54 D5 Dolicha? Ins.

label: Ephyra/Kichyros
description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 54 C3 Ephyra/Kichyros

label: Ithaca (island)
description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 54 C5 Ithaca Ins.

label: Nerikos?
description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 54 C4 Nerikos?

label: Same
description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 54 C5 Same

label: Syria
description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 54 C5 Syria

label: Taphos (island)
description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 54 C4 Taphos Ins.

label: Thesprotia
description: One of the three main ancient tribes of Epirus.

label: Zacynthus
description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 54 inset Zacynthus

label: Calydon
description: An ancient Greek city of Aetolia that derives its name from its founder Calydon, son of Aetolus.

label: Chalcis
description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 55 F4 Chalcis

label: Delphi
description: The ancient pan-Hellenic sanctuary of Delphi in Greece, seat of the oracle of Apollo.

label: Euboea (island)
description: Euboea is the second largest Greek island by area and is separated from the Greek mainland by the Euripus Strait.

label: Iolkos
description: Iolkos was an ancient city located in Magnesia, Thessaly, Greece.

label: Oichalia
description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 55 B3 Oichalia

label: Orchomenos/Orchomenus
description: The so-called "Boeotian Orchomenos", located in the vicinity of the Byzantine church of Panaghia Skripou. The longer, modern title is used to distinguish this settlement from another Greek site with the same ancient name located in Arcadia in the Peloponnese.

label: Ossa (mountain)
description: A mountain in central Greece (between Olympus and Pelion), important in Greek mythology. Several ancient cities and a shrine to the Muses were located on its western slopes.

label: Panopeos/Phanotis
description: A city of Phocis on the Boeotian frontier.

label: Parnassus (mountain)
description: A mountain of central Greece located north of the Gulf of Corinth. In Greek mythology Parnassus was sacred to Apollo and was the home of the Muses.

label: Pherai
description: Pherai was an ancient city of Thessaly in the district of Pelasgiotis.

label: Phthiotis
description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 55 C2 Phthiotis

label: Phylake
description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 55 D2 Phylake

label: Scyrus (island)
description: The island of Skyros in the Aegean Sea.

label: Thebai/Thebae
description: The ancient city of Thebes in Boeotia (modern Greece).

label: Aegae
description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 56 E4 Aegae

label: Chios (island)
description: Chios is the fifth largest of the Greek islands.

label: Ilium/Troia
description: An ancient city of northwest Anatolia with occupation ranging from the Bronze Age to the Roman period. Troy features as the central setting of Homer's Iliad.

label: Lemnos (island)
description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 56 A2 Lemnos Ins.

label: Lesbos (island)
description: Lesbos is an island of the northeastern Aegean Sea and was named for the son of Lapithos, the descendant of Deucalion and Helen.

label: Mimas (mountain)
description: Boz Dağ.

label: Psyra (island)
description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 56 B4 Psyra Ins.

label: Tenedos (island)
description: An island located in the Aegean Sea 5 km off the coast of Troas.

label: Achaea/Achaia (region)
description: An ancient Greek region on the northern coast of the Peloponnese.

label: Alphe(i)os (river)
description: The longest river of the Peloponnesus.

label: Argos
description: Argos was a city of ancient Greece that reached its cultural highpoint under Pheidon in the seventh century BC.

label: Elis (city)
description: Elis was an ancient city that served as the capital of the district of the same name.

label: Erymanthos M.
description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 58 B2 Erymanthos M.

label: Geraistos Pr.
description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 58 H2 Geraistos Pr.

label: Geren(i)a
description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 58 C4 Geren(i)a

label: Kyllene (mountain)
description: A mountain in Arcadia (Greece), still known as Kyllene today.

label: Kythera
description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 58 inset Kythera

label: Lacedaemon/Laconia
description: Lacedaemon/Laconia is a region comprising the south-eastern part of the Peloponnese.

label: Lapithos (mountain)
description: Lapithas.

label: Malea
description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 58 C3 Malea

label: Malea Pr.
description: Cape Maleas is a cape located in the southeast of the Peloponnese.

label: Messene
description: Capital of Messenia

label: Mycenae
description: Mycenae was an ancient settlement of the Argolid, with the earliest occupation evident ca. 2900 B.C. As the eponymous site of the Mycenaean culture of the Aegean Bronze Age, the site flourished as a fortified citadel during the mid to late second millennium B.C. In the first millennium B.C., the site experienced a revival of fortunes, although by Strabo's time the settlement had vanished.

label: Olympia
description: Ancient sanctuary of Zeus and home of the ancient Olympic games.

label: Pylos
description: An archaic through Roman settlement located at the Armatova hill, west of Agrapidochori in Ileia in the Peloponnese.

label: Pylos/Koryphasion
description: A Classical settlement, probably the Pylos of Thucydides, on the Koryphasion promontory, (modern Akr. Koryphasiou in Messenia) in the Peloponnese.

label: Sparta
description: Sparta was a prominent city-state (polis) of ancient Greece.

label: Styx (river)
description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 58 C1 Styx fl.

label: Athena, T.
description: The Temple of Athena at Sounion is an Ionic temple of the fifth century B.C. built atop the foundations of an earlier temple.

label: Athenae
description: A major Greek city-state and the principal city of Attika. Modern Athens in Greece.

label: Marathon
description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 59 C2 Marathon

label: Creta (island)
description: The island of Crete is the largest of the Greek islands and the fifth-largest island in the Mediterranean Sea.

label: Eileithyias Antron
description: The Cave of Eileithyia on Crete is an ancient sanctuary sacred to the goddess of childbirth. The shrine was active during Neolithic, Minoan, and Mycenaean phases.

label: Gortyn(a)
description: The Roman capital of Creta et Cyrenaica province, then Creta, and later seat of the Archbishop of Crete, Gortyna was a thriving community from the Geometric period to the Middle Byzantine period. The first traces of urban settlement date from the Archaic period. The ancient Greek law code known as the "Gortyn Code" was discovered there in 1884.

label: ‘Ketia’? Pr.
description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 60 F2 ‘Ketia’? Pr.

label: Knosos/Col. Iulia Nobilis Cnosos
description: A major ancient settlement of Crete located some 5 km southeast of Heraklion, Knossos was occupied from the Neolithic period to the time of the Roman empire.

label: Kydonia
description: An ancient settlement on Crete inhabited since the Neolithic period, Kydonia has been a major center of Minoan, Greek, and Byzantine civilization.

label: Lato
description: Lato was an ancient city of Crete, a Dorian city-state located on Mirabello Bay. The principal ruins date to the fifth and fourth centuries B.C. and the city was destroyed ca. 200 B.C.

label: Phaistos
description: An ancient settlement on Crete where occupation began ca. 3000 B.C., Phaistos was a major center of the Minoan civilization and continued to be a Greek city of the first millennium B.C.

label: Delos (settlement)
description: The ancient settlement of Delos, located on the Aegean island of the same name.

label: Dia? (island)
description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 61 B4 Dia? Ins.

label: Ortygia
description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 61 E2 Ortygia

label: Samos (island)
description: The island of Samos.

label: Phoenice (region)
description: Ancient Phoenicia.

label: Sidon/Col. Aurelia Pia
description: Sidon/Col. Aurelia Pia is an ancient maritime city and Phoenician metropolis

label: Cyprus (island)
description: Third largest island in the Mediterranean Sea.

label: (Nea) Paphos
description: The legendary birthplace of the goddess Aphrodite, (Nea) Paphos has been a center of activity since the Final Bronze Age when Mycenaeans honored the goddess there. The site was listed on the UNESCO World Heritage List in 1980.

label: Libya
description: An ancient place, cited: None

label: Nilus (river)
description: The Nile is a major river of northeastern Africa and is generally acknowledged as the longest river in the world, measuring some 6,650 km (4,130 miles) from source to mouth.

label: Pharos
description: The Pharos lighthouse of Alexandria, one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World, was built under the Ptolemies between 280 and 247 BC.

label: Libya Inferior
description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 101 M5 Libya Inferior

label: Egypt
description: Country spanning the northeast corner of Africa and southwest corner of Asia

label: East Macedonia and Thrace
description: administrative region of Greece
